sense.name: fall or cause to fall
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[topic] TUMBLE PP[temporal] NP1[topic] TUMBLE PP[locative] NP1[agent] TUMBLE NP2[patient] PP[instrument] Note: implies moving to a lower position, physically or abstractly
sense.examples: The buildings tumbled to the ground from the force of the earthquake. The child tumbled the tower of blocks with his hand. Their hopes for peace tumbled when the new government announced its intentions. Energy stocks tumbled today in heavy trading. His album has recently tumbled on the charts. Their team has tumbled from first place after this loss. I tumbled out of bed at five this morning. (figurative)

sense.name: whirl something about, roll over and over
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[instrument] TUMBLE (DRY) NP2[patient] NP1[topic] TUMBLE PP[locative] Includes: TUMBLE DRY Note: implies a repeated turning motion
sense.examples: We are tumbling these rocks in order to polish them. This fabric should be tumbled at low heat in the dryer. I'll just tumble the towels dry. The little boy kicked the stone and watched it tumble along the street. He admitted to having tumbled her sister. (have sex, figurative use)

sense.name: toss together, jumble
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] TUMBLE NP2[patient] PP
sense.examples: John tumbled some eggs and spices in a skillet and made an omelet. They tumbled the teams with no apparent pattern. The bedclothes were tumbled in a heap.

sense.name: understand, get wise to
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[animate] TUMBLE TO NP2[state]
sense.examples: They don't tumble to the seriousness of this problem. I think she's tumbled to our little joke.

sense.name: perform gymnastics
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[topic] TUMBLE Note: implies a purposeful, practiced activity.
sense.examples: The girls are tumbling in the gym. Sam broke his wrist while tumbling.
